content.description: Massive dyno into the finish of 23. Stand start matched on jug above the painted 23. Dyno all the way to the large shelf 6 or so feet directly above you.
content.location: Center of the wall and right above the painted 23.

content.description: Easy start but goes for a long left hand crimp.
content.location: Starts on a big jug above the white painted "23" on the wall.

content.description: Climb the start of Michael Jordan and link it into Twenty Three.
content.location: Start underneath large rail on good jug and trend left.

content.description: Make a few moves on crimps off of a scrunchy sit start. Head straight up and slightly left into jug for 23. Beware of an hollow crimp out left.
content.location: Sit start to the right of the painted 23. Drop off jugs at the finish.

content.description: Fun route with big pulls to a frustrating sloper finish.
content.location: Directly to the left of PJ on the Roof boulder.  Roof moves to some slopey pockets.

content.description: Start on positive jug at the base of the roof (middle of the cave), crank to lip and top out.
content.location: One minute after the High Tide Boulders on the trail go left (uphill).

content.description: Decent warm up route. Sit start in pockets and climb up to a mantel.
content.location: This is the second route on the warm-up boulder. It is located about 50 feet downhill from the 23 wall, directly off of the Lincoln Lake trail.

content.description: Sit start, move through the short roof to crux right before ledge.
content.location: To the right of "pj" and "on fire"

content.description: Big moves up a highball after traversing out on a wild flake. Long and kinda highbally.
content.location: On the side of the tight ride boulder facing the lake, not visible from the trail.

content.description: Sit start and make a few moves on edges. Head up and right. Drop off at jugs.
content.location: Far left side of the 23 wall boulders.

content.description: Sit start and make a move to a ledge/rail. Work through a series of strange holds to get to the jugs and drop off.
content.location: Start is low and underneath large rail to the left of the painted 23.

content.description: Start on the obvious jug, move through pockets and slap the jug at end of roof.
content.location: 5 minutes from the dam. On the left a couple minutes past 23. Same area as “pj” and “roofies”

content.description: Same start as "Smoke". Move right and up the crack to the ledge.
Decent but short V0 on big holds through a roof.
content.location: Far left side of the roofs boulder, next to Roofies.

content.description: Sit start on arrow head flake.  Stay low and trend right as you work through fun variety of jugs, pockets, slopers, and crimps to a good jug topout directly above the last obvious pocket.
content.location: Left side of trail after coming up the hill from dam.  This problem is on the backside of the obvious chalked low roof boulder on the left.  If you get to 23 Wall on the left you've gone too far.

content.description: Fun v2 with a low start and a cool big move to an arete.
content.location: On the back side of the block boulder, this problem is one of the first chalked up problems you see entering the area.

content.description: Same start as “Block Crack”. Move left to crack and too out.
content.location: Two minutes before the 23 area on the same side of the trail.

content.description: Sit start from the arrowhead flake below the bolder.  Romp up the crack in your preferred style and top out.
content.location: In corridor boulder area on left side of trail if heading in from dam.  This boulder is located behind Block Party on same boulder.  If you get to 23 Wall Boulders you've gone too far by about 10 seconds.

content.description: This is the easier to access area and by far the most developed for boulders. The majority of established boulders for the area will be here. Mostly <v5 but a select few above, mostly v6. Good climbing all day, and perfect if you make it in the 50-60 degree temperature.
